Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: russiangirl298484
Reviews.Content: nice hotel close to the train station and near the main place of Venice. price is not too expensive, breakfast is ok

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL!”
Reviews.Author: JoJo243
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here to celebrate our engagement, what a huge mistake!! We initally booked to stay in a hotel just outside of the city but decided to swap our hotels and selected this one as the location was a little more central and on the website the rooms looked quite pleasant. Imagine our surprise when on check-in we were shown to a door opposite the hotel with an iron grate across it, leading us up to a tiny room with two single camp beds and a shared bathroom! We immediately went back downstairs to speak to management as we'd booked and paid for a double en suite and figured there must have been a mistake. On seeing us the man on reception walked away and hid behind a staff door! After being ignored for some time we decided to go for dinner in the hope that when we returned somebody else would be on shift. Eventually at about 10pm we were spoken to - IN FLUENT ENGLISH!! - by another member of staff who changed his tone as soon as he realised we were complaining and pretended he did not understand, we then put our best efforts into describing the situation in Italian and after some time he understood that we wouldn't be giving up until we were properly acknowledged. We were offered 20Euros as a refund but no choice to upgrade as there were 'no other rooms available' This was the hotel from hell, pervy italian locals would sit on the landing accross from the shared (ergh) bathroom every morning wearing next to nothing. Bugs, unwashed sheets, a huge broken fan (possibly the air conditioning advertised?!) taking up half the space in the tiny room and squeaky old camp beds. I am fully aware of the difference between 5* luxury and budget accommodation, considering the price we paid (Â£450 for 3 nights) I was not expecting butler service but a little cleanliness and a room that matches the 'professional' photographs would have been nice. Venice is a beautiful city, do not ruin your holiday by booking a room here!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Joke of a 3* - Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: NA2541
Reviews.Content: If you are in Venice, it will be well worth spending more than $130, and getting something better than this. It is nowhere near as good as even a 2*. I cannot believe I paid this much for such a dingy room. Paid for a double bed, got two singles, in a separate building. When we entered this building, there were huge dirty laundry sacks lying right next to the door awaiting us; the lobby smelled of chlorine and was still not clean. Went upstairs to the room, the carpet in the lobby upstairs had holes. The room was super-tight, not even enough room to walk straight and therefore it was even worse with our 2 suitcases ;-(. The washbasin was outside of the bathroom, across from the bed in between, on the other side of the room â€“ never seen such an arrangement in my life before, that too in a hotel. Service was horrible and in todayâ€™s day and age â€“ they charge 1.5 euros for half an hour internet use in the lobby, on a dirty computer â€“ itâ€™s not even wireless! Were in Venice for 3 days and loved it, but the thought of going back to hotel was always dreadful â€“ At the end of a long, tiring day, didnâ€™t looked forward to it at all. Ruined the whole experience. Friendly advice â€“ for your sake, if you want to have a good time â€“ close your eyes and do not even consider this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for big groups.”
Reviews.Author: Emchar90
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a college photography trip, there was about 25 of us and it was perfect for what we needed. was extremely simple, but we were out all day and only in there too sleep so did't need much more. Beds were simple but comfy, bathroom was small, but didn't need a massive one, very old school decor, but I think it's all part of the Venician charm. The stair ways and the Lobbys were smashing. Breakfast was smashing, loads too choose from. PC's in the lobby were usefull! And it's a close enough walk to restaurants but just far enough away to be out of the way. And across the bridge is a take away pizza shop! yumm. Couldn't complain as was pefect for what we needed it for, staf very friendly and smiley!!

Reviews.Title: “They post photos of a nice room and give a filthy, horrendous room. Don't Stay!”
Reviews.Author: luis f
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel paying $125 per night based of photos they show on their web site and on different booking sites, showing a beautiful bed in a nicely decorated Venice style room. When we arrived the receptionist told us that was a 3 star room and we reserved a 2 star room. He sent us across the street to an extremely dirty building, poorly kept, with stains all over the rugs, all laundry bags on the floor at the entrance and a really disgusting room. We are very open minded travelers and have stayed in every kind of room around the world. What bothers is to feel fooled by a hotel that sells one thing and delivers another. We decided to upload some photos so you can judge for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Look_East
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, the room is small but clean, bathroom facilities were good. The staff were very friendly. We found the location of this hotel very good, as we arrived by train we were able to walk within minutes to the hotel. If you want to visit St. Marks square etc., then this would take you approx. 1 hour to walk at a leisurely pace, however there are plenty of water taxis. The thing we found let this hotel down was the breakfast, we have never found such a poor selection anywhere, no fruit, stale bread, almost undrinkable coffee. We did mention this but no-one really seemed to care, you take it or leave it. We decided to leave it. We would not choose to stay at this hotel again. We found Venice generally to have an unacceptable level of dog mess and graffiti, which is a shame in an otherwise very beautiful city. Another observation (and probably an obvious one) but Venice is not wheelchair friendly. Even the relatively new pedestrian bridge near the rail station has steps rather than ramps.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel too far out”
Reviews.Author: suzie0
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel but we were on a tour so had the advantage of the transport provided. The room were clean the food nice woudl stay again but only if transport provided to Venice

Reviews.Title: “Great value great location”
Reviews.Author: Eddiev12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location with great value for Money. The bad reviews for this hotel seem to be simply "nit picking". The staff were friendly the breakfast was more than acceptable if your simply looking for an affordable, clean and convenient hotel stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely needs to be refreshed”
Reviews.Author: DawnfromFrance
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 3 nights in the main building (the annex is a 2 stars facility). Things I did like: -Cleanliness of the room, kindness of the receptionists, queen size bed, nearness of the vaporetto station, quiet area. Things I did not like: noisy A/C - bad sound insulation - the shower separated from the bathroom (toilet pan and basin in one room , shower cubicle inside the bedroom = not really nice for intimacy) - no Internet in rooms (expensive use of a computer in the lobby: 1,5 euros for 15 minutes) - No TV channel in other language than Italian - the bedside lamps were not working -The room needs to be refreshed (old wallpaper and furnitures, the shower head was leaking).

Reviews.Title: “can be better”
Reviews.Author: LOVENORVAY
Reviews.Content: This was the third and last hotel that i stayed during my visit in Italy this April The hotel staff was not very attentive, friendly or helpful and none of them had any sense of urgency. When we asked for a restaurant recommendation, the guy seemed dumbfounded and only had one suggestion. I did not have any issues with noise. The bed wasn't the most comfortable. I was very disappointed with the breakfast buffet. It consisted of the same food as the other hotels we stayed at in Italy, but the food was not good, so I only ate there on our first morning. And beware of their 'coffee.' It had a burnt taste, so bad I couldn't finish one cup. The location was not the greatest. An easy walk from the train station, however if you like to stay in the middle of Venice, try getting a hotel that is close to San Marco square.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS....need I say more?”
Reviews.Author: Alaska_Lola
Reviews.Content: Hotel was hard to find. Asked 3 locals and finally got directions to the hotel. Hotel staff was not friendly as all and we are friendly travelers. No elevator and we had heavy luggage. The room was shabby and shower was extrememly small. Half of the lights in the room did not work. I woke the first morning covered in bed bug bites!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!!!!! Awful Hotel...RUDE, DIRTY, AND BUGS”
Reviews.Author: ddriebel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel because it was a good deal for a location which seemed to be ideal. The reviews all were pretty good compared to other ones in our budget. BUT...lets just say...if you are looking for a hotel to stay in, if you stay here, you mid as well save the extra money and just stay in a hostel. The hotel staff are rude. We ordered a double room through orbitz.com. When we finally found the hotel, which was difficult because the staff never emailed me back with directions after repeated attempts, they said they didnt have our reservation. I had the confirmation number and gave them the sheet I printed from Orbitz. They made some phone calls and found us a room. They put us in a room the size of a shoe box, and was not a double. We complained and they answered us telling us that since they didnt have our reservation, (because one of their staff made a mistake) that they had to put us there, but not to worry, it was an upgrade from their two star Annex hotel to this 3 star room. Which was a lie. If this was 3 stars, I would hate to see what the 2 stars looked like. When I went to take a shower, their was a bug and an "unknown hair" in the bath tub...as as we went to bed, we found another bug dead in the sheets. We tore off the comforter and slept with a blanket we brought with us. The next morning we went down to complain again thinking a new employee would hear our complaints. She, who we think was the owner, described what they gave us, or upgraded us to, in her words....as "A Gift." She said, "look at it like a gift, we upgraded u from 2 stars to 3. A gift." lol. I about fell over. And i suppose the pubic hair and bug was the wrapping paper and bow on our gift huh? PS...theres no elevator, and no internet. We asked about wifi, and were told..."Yes we have a wireless connection, but it is for staff only and is blocked...there are computers over there with internet." Yea, at 1 euro for 15 minutes, we passed up that GREAT OPPORTUNITY. Overall...i do not suggest this hotel. For what they charge, you will get the same thing paying half the price in a hostel. If you want something nice, stay away from here. AWFUL HOTEL! And the 3 stars should be taken away, because to any standards Ive ever known, it doesnt even deserve 1 star. I would be happy to give further info on Venice and better areas to stay if anyone is interested. [--]

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing value for a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: sartobe
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy to find and not difficult to reach by foot, even if dragging bags from the station. The reception staff were very helpful and pleasant. The hotel, however, felt like a 2 star hotel pretending to be 3 star. Tired, shabby dining room and very poor quality breakfast - no effort to present food pleasantly; sliced pineapple was over-ripe and fermenting; bread was thinly sliced, stale and dry, while croissants on the first morning were also stale. They were fresher the next morning after a complaint was made. The fruit, however, bread and presentation remained unchanged. The short breakfast time meant the room was crowded and there was the distinct feeling that costs were being cut all round. The bedroom was not as roomy as the hotel's pictures depict, but was comfortable and the bed comfortable. Mosquitoes disturbed our first night's sleep, but on request, we were given a plug-in repellant that worked well for the rest of our stay. Bathroom was tiny. The shower was good but small and with only a curtain, water spread over most of the floor. The room and bathroom were clean. The floor unfortunately remained dusty and very gritty for the 3 days. The well functioning air-conditioner was very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, good service, great location”
Reviews.Author: ryanmacluso
Reviews.Content: very convenient location. Close to the Piazalle Roma for ground transportation, the train station, and the vaporetto (water bus) stop. Breakfast was not that great except for the coffee and criossants, but it was included and the breakfast room was very nice. The yellow sign outside the hotel made it very easy to find the hotel, which is a big plus in Venice. Definitely a great deal for Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: londongirl23
Reviews.Content: I went to Venice with my boyfriend for a long weekend, we booked through ebookers and there was no option to select what type of room. When we arrived we were shown to a tiny room with two single beds on opposite sides, which we weren't at all happy with. All the pictures looked lovely, so we asked if there was any chance of moving to a double room, to which we were told no as they had a group coming. The breakfast was really bad, coffee was ok, but it consisted of one croissant, some dry french toast (from a packet) boiled eggs, and stale cereal. The area was lovely, and it was nice and quiet, and about a 30min walk from St Mark's but I wouldn't choose to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Genuine Venetian exp”
Reviews.Author: TravelLady511
Reviews.Content: The photos on this hotel's website are very pretty but, as is typical, the very best rooms are shown. Since I was traveling with a small group of friends, I got to see 6 rooms beside my own. My single room and bathroom each had open-able 8 foot tall windows and shutters with a great, quiet view over a small campo with trees and shrubs. It also had a terrazzo floor and spacious (by Venetian stds) bathroom. My friends' rooms didn't have much in the way of windows and their bathrooms were tiny and didn't have windows. The twin beds in each room are Euro-style which are narrower than our American twin beds. Everything in Venice smells at least a little damp and this hotel was no different. Not unpleasant to me but some of my friends complained. We stayed for4 nights. Enough about room set ups! This hotel is on Rio Marin, a small canal, & about 10-15 mins easy walk away from Ferrovia train station. (If you go to Venice, travel light because you have to schlep everything over several or many sets of bridges each with a set of stairs going up and going down.) This hotel is about 10 mins easy walk to Santa Maria Gloriosa dei Frari church (aka Frari Church) with its glorious Titian and Bellini paintings, and Donatello sculpture. Some of us attended Easter services at Frari and were blown away by the gloriousness of this church's art, altars, monuments, etc. Breakfast each morning was not very interesting but satisfying - hardboiled eggs, white cheese chunks, yogurts, toasts, croissants, 2 cold cereals, 2 juices, a big jar of Nutella, 3 bowls of jam, coffee/tea/cappucino. No fruit or veg that I recall. There are 2 internet stations in the lobby at about 1 Euro for 15 mins. However, whenever I tried to pay they wouldn't take my money - probably because I was only on for a few minutes each time. A couple of warnings - there is no elevator in this multi-storied hotel. Also, there is a high step just to the left of the reception desk. I missed it the first night and fell onto the marble floor very, very hard resulting in huge bruises on my shins and ankle tops and a deeply scraped left knee. The man at the desk offered me no assistance or apologies except to pick my baggage claim ticket off the floor and gave it to me.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Rainai
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because the college organised a trip to Milan. We stayed here for 1 night before flying back home. The decor was amazing and breakfast was not a lot. The city is confusing so it's quite hard finding the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome - good value”
Reviews.Author: Jasper58
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip through the hotel's website where they often offer rooms in the annex at a heavily discounted rate if you agree to pay in cash. Whist this sounded a little bit worrying the value of the offer, given the location of the hotel, was too good to resist. On arrival the hotel was not full and we were given rooms in the hotel itself rather than the annex at no extra cost. We experienced none of the noise from other guests described by others, in the height of summer the a/c was good. The breakfast was nothing to write home about (I'm intrigued to read that only two months earlier 'home made pastries' were on offer - perhaps if you lived in the kraft factory they were 'home made') but was fine. The location was really good - easy to get just about anywhere on the island on foot and with good connections to public transport. The staff manning the desk were very friendly, speaking any number of languages and offering a warm welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - annex not so nice”
Reviews.Author: beachtoo
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for one night following our Mediterranean cruise. It was in a great location, close to the Grand Canal, but should you decide to stay, be sure to book into the main part of the hotel. We stayed in the annex - across the walkway - which wasn't as nice. The room was very large, so it would accomodate a family of 5 at least, but the bathroom was miniscule, the beds uncomfortable, and we were assaulted by mosquitos all night. The plus side was it was across the canal from a wonderful gelato stand, and there was a nice breakfast room with home made pastries.

Reviews.Title: “Deception!”
Reviews.Author: pursra
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is Rated 3 Star? The Good. This hotel is in a great spot, 10 mins from the train, bus terminals. Located in a quiet spot next to a canal off the main canal. Staff were friendly enough whilst we were staying there. Breakfast was adequate, cereal,meats, cheeses, crossants. Maps and advise were supplied. The Bad. Our Room and the Web site room were Totally Different. The walls are thin and you can hear whats going on in the adjacent room.eg 2am in the morning school girls playing music. (staff did speak to those concerned) Mosquitos in room at night. (make sure you kill them before sleeping) Wardrobe couldnt be opened fully as it hit on the bed. Hotel cost was high Be aware of catching a taxi from hotel to Morano island by watertaxi, 5 euros each but you are escorted into the glass factory and pressured to buy. Two computers were for internet access but at a high price

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: Eileen-Mark
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on our way to another part of Italy. Small quaint hotel. The location is good - approx. 10 minutes walk from Piazzale Roma and the Santa Lucia train station. Rooms were small but ok for Venice when you spend very little time indoors. One gripe I have is that when booking the hotel I requested a cot for our 5 month old son. I was then advised by the hotel that this would cost â‚¬25 per night! Absolutely disgraceful. We have never had to pay extra before and stayed in a hotel in Treviso (see review of BHR Hotel) at the end of this holiday and the cot was provided free. Breakfast was from 7am-9.30am. I had breakfast at 7am which was basic but when my other travelling companions went at 9am, there was very little left. Also the breakfast room was full with only one member of staff both serving and clearing tables. Not good.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Area, great travel links”
Reviews.Author: SarahPerera
Reviews.Content: Myself and my friend have just returned from a three night stay at this hotel and I decided to write a review because I consulted the reviews on here before I booked. Of course all reviews have to be taken with the understanding that most people will only write something if they had an expereince that was at one end of the scale either very bad or very good so I have tried to be subjective. On Finding the hotel - had we not been distracted by our hunger and ended up on the other side of Venice the Hotel would have been very easy to find, infact when we started to look fo it we found it very easily! the Hotel is less than 10 minutes from the bus station where Ryanair passangers are likely to have been dropped of by the coach and about 5 minutes from the train station just over the bridge. This was brilliant as obviously the lack of taxi's means you have to find your own way unless you get on the water taxi as soon as you get there. On the area - The hotel is in a nice quiet area given how close it is to the grand canal, which was nice as we felt safe staying there and walking to and from the hotel. The canal that runs by the front of the hotel is lovely and favourite with the Gondala's so makes a lovely spot to sit by and take pictures. Obviously Venice's narrow streets are a bit strange at first to those who are not used to them and some of the surrounding "streets" are abit narrow but this is somehting that you will experience all round the island. On the Hotel itself - The hotel was fine, all hotels that we looked at in venice were either the same price or more expensive. The reception is open 24 hours and you leave your key when you go out. Our room was a little disappointing as it did resemble a corridor being so long and thin but we soon got used to it and were comfortable enough. I will say however the walls are very very thin and we could hear our neighbours which at times was very unpleasent and late at night very frustrating. Breakfast was standard european buffett style although you should get there early otherwise you might not get much to eat. We shared a bathroom with our floor (4 or 5 other rooms) but we didn't have a problem with queues or how clean it was as it was kept to a high standard. I would recommend the hotel espcially given the area but I would mention about the noise from the neighbours.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid, avoid, avoid!”
Reviews.Author: civismundi
Reviews.Content: A few years ago, the Hotel Basilea was wonderful--a small hotel in a great location near the train station as well as San Polo. The staff--every one--was superbly helpful and kind. THEN the hotel was sold and became its dire opposite. The new owners seem to have specialized in hiring low-pay help whom they appear to treat like slaves. The hotel has lost all of its charm and special Venetian hospitality and has sadly become a terrible experience. We used to love this hotel. Now we avoid it like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Venice”
Reviews.Author: Barulia
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Basilea with its central location (near the train Terminal) and easy to get to from everywhere. The room was the classic Venetian experience with the imitation Louis XIV furniture and we loved it. Bathroom was clean and the staff were really good. Breakfast was very ample and set up us nicely for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go in the bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: LondonMac81
Reviews.Content: When I booked the hotel, there wasn't a room left in the main hotel, so I was booked into the 2 star annex. I had a single room to myself, and bathroom. The room was tiny but adequate and clean with airconditioning, good window coverings, and cable tv (CNN). The only real complaint I had was the bathroom. It was less than clean and I did not feel particularly clean in there - I spent as little time as possible there! Having said that, the staff were lovely and the men at the front desk very helpful and impressed me by swapping between English, French and itialian at the drop of a hat. The breakfasts were standard European fair, but they would cook you eggs or an omlette for no extra cost. The best thing about this hotel is how easy it is to find and get to from the train and bus station (3 bridges, pretty good for venice!). It is in a great location near the train station with ferries going everywhere you might want to go regularly. All up, good value for Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great cheap city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marcus5976
Reviews.Content: If you've stayed in city hotels and are realistic about the fact 'you get what you pay for', this is an excellant value for money hotel. We were given a free upgrade to the 3* area of the hotel as I e-mailed the hotel prior to arrival and gave some bull ---- about getting engaged...if you don't ask you don't get! The hotel is in a quiet area of Venice although the locals do gather around a bar just next door which can be a bit noisy, if hot and you have the windows open.The rooms are nice and comfortable and the breakfast fills you up. If you're prepared to walk around Venice rather than just do the touristy thing, this hotel is a great base. We spent 3 hours walking to St Mark's square through quaint side streets...there's a shop on each corner and suddenly you find yourself in a small square with other attractions. If you want the 'slap bang in the middle of everything hotel' this isn't for you. If you are prepared to wander and walk and see what you come across...this is brilliant. I work in the travel industry and am quite picky but I read the reviews and thought let's go for it and I'm glad we did. This area is a lot cheaper for food and eating out than the South of Venice and anyone moaning about the cost obviously hasn't travelled to many European cities. A dinner out is no more than you would pay here... We paid â‚¬50.00 for a 2 course meal including 1/2 litre of wine each. All in all we loved Venice particually as there was no cars to keep looking the wrong way for! My advice is go there and this hotel will do you justice if you want no frills but comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “The Chandelier Closet”
Reviews.Author: askjwc
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with our two-night stay at the Hotel Basilea, in a room that fondly became known as our 'chandelier closet'. We stayed in a building across the way from the main hotel and lobby. Our room was wide enough to accommodate a twin bed and a sink and long enough for two beds. A chandelier hung from the ceiling to create an element of splendor in an otherwise confined space. The hotel and the rooms were clean, as was the communal bathroom, shared by approximately five other bedrooms on the floor. The best thing about the Hotel Basilea was its location, just a short walk from the bus depot and train station. It was far away enough from the more bustling areas of Venice so that we could get a quiet night of rest. The price also couldn't be beat. We booked through Expedia and got a great deal, probably a third of the price of other hotels in Venice proper. The negatives: The walls are thin, and in our case, we happened to be staying next to a loud snorer. The beds are a bit hard, though this seems to be common in Italy. And of course a shared bathroom means that you'll find times when you need to wait your turn. All in all, we were happy with our stay and would recommend the Hotel Basilea for travelers who want an inexpensive place without the frills, but comes with privacy that hostels often lack.

Reviews.Title: “Canal Peace”
Reviews.Author: galrua
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to have received mixed reviews so here's our spake!: We found it very easily to be honest and we had to cross only 3 bridges to find it, it was signposted so perhaps other visitors did not see the signs. We had been dreading an hour of sheer lugging across watery streets and endless bridges so were very relieved to tind it close by. There were no frills - the concierge was polite but a man of few words and yes, there is no help with the luggage but we didn't care for that anyhow. A clean, atmospheric room with a very comfortable bed and the silence was very welcome. Didn't make it for breakfast on either day but you wo,nt go hungry in venice.

Reviews.Title: “Best night of the 6-day trip in Italy!”
Reviews.Author: artgog
Reviews.Content: I booked it over the internet and arrived there as we planned at the 9 o'clock evening after a long day at Florence, We are exhausted! And is this little place to provide us with the warm room, hot shower, very comfortable beds for me, my wife and our 2 children. We've slept like the baby... And, the breakfast next morning is wonderful! it is the one of the best breakfast we've had during our trip, especially, for us whom had used to the North American style breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “If this is a 3 star I do not want to see a 2 star”
Reviews.Author: kwick709
Reviews.Content: Okay so I may be a bit of a hotel snob as I work for a one of the largest premier hotel companies in the world, but even so I would say that this was a definite "average" hotel. The hotel desperately needs updating - the breakfast is great, service is very hit and miss, our room was cramped. However, it is in a lovely part of town -very near to the train station and main vaporetto stops. You can walk to San Marco in about 30 minutes. Only a couple of nice restaurants nearby that we could find (but we did get lost a lot!). The shower/bath were great. We were supposed to be in the 2 star annex - thank God we were put in the 3 star main building. With the right investment and leadership this could be molto bueno.

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: wheelman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights with my wife. Was not easy to find but that's part of the charm of Venice which is a beautiful place. I had booked a cash only deal that the hotel had advertised and I emailled the hotel to inform them that we would be arriving late in the evening. Despite the cash only deal the hotel charged the first night of our stay to my credit card. This has never happened at any hotel I have stayed in before or since. The staff were not over friendly at best and one in particular at check out conducted the transaction without making eye contact and barely acknowledging our presence.......not an easy thing to do. The room was not one of those shown by the hotel on the 'net. It was clean but the decor and furniture was past it's sell by date. Breakfast was very average but the staff in here were friendly. It seems to me that the staff here do not make too much of an effort because Venice is very popular and so Hotel occupancy would be quite high on comparison with other places. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay of my trip”
Reviews.Author: Denvergal9
Reviews.Content: Hotel Basilea is listed as a quaint hotel - convenient to the train station. Yes, if you want to carry luggage over three bridges. The front desk person is not helpful and the hotel is run down, not quaint -also not very clean. NO ELEVATOR!!! and also no help with bags up the stairs. Asked front desk to book water taxi for the next morning and he said he did and when we got up at the appointed time, he told us no water taxi and we had to get to the airport. It is not the usual experience in Venice. Stay here at your own peril.

Reviews.Title: “Superb & quiet location, charming rooms and attentive staff.”
Reviews.Author: ValMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I had originally booked another hotel in Venice but was told that there was a problem with the plumbing in my room and so was moved to this hotel owned by the same owners. I had arrived late at night with a backpack and had spent the last half hour before arriving at the hotel looking for it so was not pleased to hear this on arrival. I protested slightly and the elderly gentleman at reception offered to carry my backpack (!) to the other hotel which turned out to be the Basilea. What a blessing in disguise the broken plumbingl turned out to be! The Basilea is situated a five minute easy walk from both the train station and bus station. It is situated on a quiet and most delightful little canal. I was completely smitten by it when on my 2nd night I saw a gondola and young gondolier going by heading out towards the grand canal for customers with his small pet dog on board! Close to the hotel is a tiny but funky little bar that appears to attract loyal local customers. It was a perfect place to sit, unwind and watch the odd gondola go by as you cradle a glass of Spritz. There is a great little bakery close by for a nice mid-morning shot of good caffeine. Again, it is a place that appears to be frequented more by locals than tourists. The hotel itself I found to be charming. The rooms are decked out in lovely Venetian decor complete with gold guilding etc. on furnishings and lovely matching bedspreads and chandeliers. My room was towards the side of the canal and like a previous reviewer mentioned, you had to stick your head out of the window to see it but I would rather this as the canals can sometimes get a little noisy with the passing morning traffic. Nevertheless, I had no problems with noise. Windows appear to be double glazed and excess heat was no problem as rooms are air-conditioned. My bathroom on both occasions was of a good size with a full sized (double, I think) shower with excellent water pressure and beautiful thick and fluffy white towels. Rooms were cleaned to a very high standard daily. Breakfast was standard buffet with cold meats, pastries and a "cooked" option which consisted of scrambled eggs. There was also a type of breakfast cereal plus yoghurt and canned fruits etc. Admittedly, coffee was not fab but you could get your fix just 10 metres away (see above). Staff were super friendly. My Venice map is scribbled with their directions and suggestions for a nice bar, a small little trattoria, the best way to get to the Basilica, etc. etc. I was greeted very warmly daily and my every need during my stay was met more than adequately. This is a charming and quiet hotel superbly situated close to transport and major attractions staffed with warm, attentive and importantly knowledgeable local staff. I stayed a total of 8 days during a 2 week period and would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Understand the swinging reviews”
Reviews.Author: Berri_1981
Reviews.Content: Those looking at the reviews on this site are probably going to be confused by the markedly varied opinions about this hotel. Here are my two cents to try and make things a little easier: 1. Firstly, Venice is one of the most incrediably beautiful cities I have ever visited. Waking up with the canals on your door step is a lovely experience (but compared to staying inland in say Mestre, is a luxury you pay for). 2. This hotel is a little tired but from research, the price is about average for a hotel of this standard. 3. The room size varies enormously in this hotel - we had a tiny room whilst others had much more substantial sized rooms. Our twin room did have a lovely garden view. 4. The service is not overtly friendly but not unhelpful regarding specific requests. 5. The "hot" breakfast consists of an omlette by request but is otherwise the same standard buffet. 6. The room was cleaned daily to a good standard. 7. The location is excellent - close to the bus and train station, in a quiet part of town but not too far from the Rialto/St Marco (20 min stroll). If I return to Venice, I would want to look into hiring an apartment for a week so I could self-cater and take advantage of the markets. For a weekend stay, I don't think Hotel Basilea is a bad choice - Venice is not a city where your hotel will make or break your experience.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother”
Reviews.Author: Traveler3434
Reviews.Content: We had a bad experience at this hotel. When we arrived at midnight, after walking for an hour in the rain to find the hotel, we were told that our (pre-paid) room was not available, even though I had arranged with them for a late check-in. We were told that another hotel had a room for us. We arrived at the second hotel and there was no such room. They sent us to a third hotel, where the rain was coming down the walls inside and we were shown a twin bunk bed (this was supposed to be a romantic vacation). We were told that we would not receive any refund, even if we took the inferior room. When we threatened to cancel payment and go elsewhere (now around 2am) they somehow found a room at the initial site, which was loud and not too clean. No apology was given. The only good thing about this hotel was the free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SheilaA
Reviews.Content: OMG, everything about this hotel was amazing! Facitliy, location and most important, staff!!!!! On my last day in Venice, I could not find my wallet. Ok typical tourist move, I know. After all the emotions of my breakdown! :( we were at the train station to catch the train to Rome and this man pulls at my arm... ok now I'm peeved... BUT, it was the Concierge telling my that they found my wallet (everything in it) and it was locket up at the hotel. He and my boyfriends partner RAN thru the streets of Venice to the hotel to get it. Both our trains were leaving in 20 min. I love the room, (on the canal), loved the location, the food, the ppl! OVERall IT WAS THE BEST!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Basilea
HotelInfo.Address: Santa Croce - Rio Marin 817, 30135 Venice, Italy
